intro: Catunaregam tomentosa, commonly known as the velvet leaf or velvet plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Catunaregam tomentosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
